benchmark_details.name: Hybrid Agent for Image Restoration
benchmark_details.overview: HybridAgent integrates multiple restoration modes into a unified image restoration model, employing fast, slow, and feedback restoration agents to optimize user interaction and effectively restore images with various types of distortions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified model for image restoration that enhances user interaction and performance on various distortion types.

data.source: Instruction tuning dataset constructed from images with 10 types of distortions, including noise, motion blur, and others.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the image restoration results compared to ground truth images.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PSNR and SSIM values indicate better restoration quality; lower LPIPS signifies better perceptual quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance results compared against several state-of-the-art all-in-one image restoration methods.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation on synthetic and real-world datasets.
